HouseServant86.title: sirviente doméstico
HouseServant86.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue sirviente(a) de rango bajo en una casa real. \n\n[PAWN_pronoun] limpiaba habitaciones y reubicaba objetos según las órdenes del responsable de la servidumbre, al tiempo que trataba de parecer invisible a los señores de la casa.

HeadButler50.title: mayordomo jefe
HeadButler50.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] estuvo al frente de la servidumbre en una casa real.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] coordinaba a los demás sirvientes para que la voluntad del señor siempre se cumpliera, incluso antes de que el señor lo supiera.

RoyalMasseuse43.title: masajista real
RoyalMasseuse43.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue el masajista personal de una prolífera casa real. [PAWN_pronoun] dio servicio a muchos miembros de la familia real y a sus invitados.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] ofrecía de vez en cuando un servicio extra, si el señor o la señora estaban de buen humor. Progresar en esta profesión implicaba poseer refinadas habilidades sociales.

MenagerieKeeper1.title: guardia de casa de fieras
MenagerieKeeper1.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] mantenía la real casa de fieras de una poderosa familia en su estado.\n\nEl trabajo de [PAWN_nameDef] incluía alimentar a elefantes, tranquilizar leones, y adiestrar aves para exhibir su plumaje a los visitantes.

BalletDancer81.title: bailarín de ballet
BalletDancer81.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue bailarín en una troupe tradicional de ballet. Dominó la expresión corporal y proporcionó entretenimiento a millares.

OrnamentMaker56.title: fabricante de ornamentos
OrnamentMaker56.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] elaboraba relojes, medallones, intrincada joyería y demás curiosidades artesanales para patrones de la realeza.

RoyalCook18.title: cocinero de la realeza
RoyalCook18.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] preparaba la comida para sus aristocráticos patrones.\n\nSólo la mejor comida era aceptable, de modo [PAWN_nameDef] se ocupaba también de un pequeño jardín en las tierras de la mansión para obtener las más frescas hierbas y verduras. Terminó sucumbiendo a la gula.

ImperialPriest24.title: sacerdote imperial
ImperialPriest24.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue sacerdote de la iglesia Imperial.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] pasaba la mitad de su tiempo estudiando libros para comprender la relación entre los aspectos de Dios y las facetas de la sociedad. La otra mitad la empleaba en demonizar la pereza y la bebida.

ImperialInquisitor53.title: inquisidor imperial
ImperialInquisitor53.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue inquisidor/a de la escuela anti-herejía de la iglesia Imperial.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] perseguía pensamientos no ortodoxos en cualquier parte - arte, música, códigos, incluso en conversaciones privadas. Al descubrir una desviación, la exponía para llevar a cabo el justo castigo. Y [PAWN_pronoun] siempre pudo encontrar la desviación si investigaba lo suficiente.

ChurchPsychic98.title: psíquico de la iglesia
ChurchPsychic98.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] asistió a la escuela psíquica de la iglesia Imperial.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] entrenó su mente para sentir las emociones e impresiones colectivas de la gente. Era un modo de comulgar con el espíritu del Imperio. También era un modo de erradicar pensamientos heréticos en tendencias peligrosas.

CorporateDrone10.title: esclavo corporativo
CorporateDrone10.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba en un gigantesco complejo de oficinas junto con miles de otros esclavos trajeados.\n\nEl trabajo en sí consistía en aburrida organización sin fin y reuniones sin sentido, puntualizadas por las ocasionales valoraciones de actuación.

CorporateManager76.title: director corporativo
CorporateManager76.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba en un una enorme oficina, vigilando que su equipo de trabajadores asignados no levantaran la cabeza de la mesa.\n\nEl trabajo era intensamente político. Para poder progresar, [PAWN_nameDef] aprendió a organizar las tareas de modo que pudiera quedarse con el crédito del trabajo de la mayoría.

CorporateFixer36.title: arreglador corporativo
CorporateFixer36.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] arreglaba los asuntos de una corporación energética. Su trabajo requería saber cuándo empujar, cuándo tirar, cuándo amagar y cuándo golpear. El trabajo encajaba con su falta natural de empatía.\n\nAunque la violencia era infrecuente, [PAWN_nameDef] estaba preparado(a) para todo.

PlanetaryMiner64.title: minero planetario
PlanetaryMiner64.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue ingeniero(a) de minas para una gran corporación minera planetaria. Su trabajo [PAWN_objective] mantenía a veces bajo tierra durante semanas, y se acostumbró a apreciar la oscuridad.

Mailman2.title: repartidor de correo
Mailman2.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] repartía el correo en sus rutas asignadas. Algunas veces se le enviaba a repartir envíos especiales en lujosas oficinas corporativas o en mansiones.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] se acostumbró muy bien a evitar y enfrentarse con perros furiosos.

Assembler69.title: ensamblador
Assembler69.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba en las líneas de ensamblaje de una fábrica, encajando piezas con la ayuda de robots.

Builder96.title: constructor
Builder96.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba en perímetros en obras, construyendo estructuras cada día siguiendo las instrucciones de su jefe.

CropFarmer17.title: granjero
CropFarmer17.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] dirigía una explotación agrícola. Analizaba el suelo, el equipo de agricultura, los patrones climatológicos, y las variaciones en los precios para optimizar el cultivo y la cosecha de interminables campos.

LivestockFarmer8.title: ganadero
LivestockFarmer8.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] dirigía una explotación ganadera. Analizaba la genética animal, los tipos de alimentos, los métodos de parto y de sacrificio, y las variaciones de precios para optimizar la crianza de enormes rebaños de todo tipo.

ServingBoy97.title: niño sirviente
ServingBoy97.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] era el hijo(a) de unos sirvientes domésticos, y fue entrenado(a) para continuar con el deber de su familia.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] transportaba cosas y lustraba objetos de plata, pero nunca se le permitió acceder al ala de los señores de la casa.

RoyalBastard3.title: bastardo real
RoyalBastard3.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue fruto de la unión de un noble y una prostituta.\n\nLa línea familiar de su padre estaba asegurada y sus posesiones legatarias estaban blindadas. Jamás nadie vino a apoyar una reclamación de [PAWN_nameDef] por el título. [PAWN_pronoun] se ganó su sustento limpiando el burdel, pero siempre sintió que merecía mucho más.

WarBastard60.title: bastardo de guerra
WarBastard60.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] nació nueve meses después de que el pueblo de su madre fuera tomado por soldados enemigos. Hijo(a) de la violencia sin padre conocido, creció en la base de una sociedad piramidal.\n\nSu madre le inculcó su amargura hacia los hombres. Su conejo mascota le ofreció más calor que ningún ser humano en su vida.

LineInfanteer20.title: infante de línea
LineInfanteer20.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue un infante ordinario en un batallón imperial.\n\nLlamado(a) a filas a una edad temprana para añadir efectivos al ejército, aprendió los métodos del combate lo bastante bien para satisfacer a sus superiores. Sin embargo, nunca entendió lo bastante bien qué era lo que sucedía a su alrededor para creer en aquello que hacía.

PiousSoldier67.title: soldado pío
PiousSoldier67.desc: Cuando no se le veía entrenando o combatiendo, [PAWN_nameDef] solía encontrarse al lado del capellán. [PAWN_pronoun] dedicó su vida a servir tanto a su señor como a su religión.

InfantryEngineer46.title: ingeniero de infantería
InfantryEngineer46.desc: A pesar de estar en un batallón de infantería, [PAWN_nameDef] apenas disparó un arma. Su especialidad era la construcción veloz de defensas, trampas, estructuras y túneles de zapadores.

InfantryMedic6.title: médico de infantería
InfantryMedic6.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trataba las heridas de combate de sus camaradas caídos.

MilitaryCook18.title: cocinero del ejército
MilitaryCook18.desc: Se dice que un ejército marcha tan rápido como su estómago. El trabajo de [PAWN_nameDef] era llenar la olla para mantener a su unidad en marcha, sin importar las condiciones.\n\nEl trabajo requería prestar atención tanto a las necesidades nutricionales como las psicológicas de la tropa.

LoyalJanissary59.title: jenízaro leal
LoyalJanissary59.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue jenízaro en el ejército de un alto señor. Más aún que las demás tropas, [PAWN_pronoun] tenía un verdadero sentido del deber, y comprendió el sentido de su vida a través del esfuerzo en el cumplimiento del deber.

ReconSniper89.title: francotirador de reconocimiento
ReconSniper89.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue francotirador/a militar profesional. Fue entrenado(a) para tomar rápidamente posiciones de tiro inusuales, eliminar objetivos clave, y desaparecer antes de que el enemigo pudiera localizar su ubicación.

Shipcracker37.title: asaltante de navíos
Shipcracker37.desc: El papel de [PAWN_nameDef] era el de lanzarse a través del vacío del espacio, aterrizar en el casco de la nave enemiga, penetrar en su interior, y tomarlo al asalto. Llegó a ser muy bueno(a) blandiendo armas pesadas de catafracto para hendir carne y acero.\n\nTambién desarrolló un gusto por las drogas que usaba para lidiar con el abrumador estrés.

BrokenSoldier29.title: soldado destrozado
BrokenSoldier29.desc:
[PAWN_pronoun] fue un gran soldado en una larga guerra de sucesión. Durante su batalla final, su unidad fue sacrificada para cubrir una retirada. [PAWN_nameDef] presenció la muerte de sus camaradas, siendo el/la último(a) superviviente.

La experiencia [PAWN_objective] devastó, dejándo[PAWN_objective] sin forma alguna con la que poder moderar sus emociones.

[PAWN_nameDef] aprendió a dibujar en el hospital.

IntelligenceAgent21.title: agente de inteligencia
IntelligenceAgent21.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue un operativo de alto rango de una agencia de contra-inteligencia encargado de interceptar a los espías enemigos.

Deserter65.title: desertor
Deserter65.desc: Tras incontables batallas por una causa en la que no creía, [PAWN_nameDef] arrojó sus armas y desertó. [PAWN_nameDef] vivió en aislamiento, atormentado(a) por aquellos a los que abandonó.

Warmonger35.title: belicista
Warmonger35.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] encabezó una ensangrentada rebelión. Los soldados que servían con [PAWN_pronoun] temían su ferocidad. Rara vez socializaban con [PAWN_nameDef], y a [PAWN_pronoun] no parecía importarle.

InfantryOfficer49.title: oficial de infantería
InfantryOfficer49.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue oficial en un batallón imperial. Desarrolló bien las habilidades sociales y de combate para llevar a cabo su trabajo, y era respetado por sus hombres.

DisgracedOfficer19.title: oficial caído en desgracia
DisgracedOfficer19.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue oficial en un batallón imperial. Desarrolló bien las habilidades sociales y de combate para llevar a cabo su trabajo, y era respetado por sus hombres.\n\nCuando su unidad fue puesta bajo fuego directo por primera vez, [PAWN_nameDef] huyó hacia un búnker y se escondió. Fue degradado(a) y nunca pudo enmendar su error.

MilitaryCommissar71.title: comisario militar
MilitaryCommissar71.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue un espía maestro infiltrado en un batallón del ejército imperial. [PAWN_pronoun] se aseguró de que los hombres fueran leales, y nunca cedió terreno a menos que se le ordenara. Esto le hizo impopular, pero obtuvo gran habilidad para detectar la más mínima falta de honestidad.

Artilleryman28.title: artillero
Artilleryman28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] cargaba proyectiles y apuntaba la artillería para aplastar a los enemigos de su ejército desde lejos.

Demolitionist39.title: experto en demoliciones
Demolitionist39.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fabricaba y plantaba explosivos para penetrar las defensas enemigas. Trabajar con explosivos cada día le enseñó a mantener la cabeza fría y la mano firme.

Firebomber51.title: incendiario
Firebomber51.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] pilotaba un pequeño caza-bombardero especializado en liberar un gel incendiario sobre objetivos inflamables.\n\nAcostumbrado(a) a amar la vista de su objetivo prediéndose en llamas, [PAWN_pronoun] llegó a adorar el fuego en todas sus formas - en la guerra, la cocina, e incluso cauterizando heridas en el hospital.

MilitaryChaplain10.title: capellán militar
MilitaryChaplain10.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] permaneció con las tropas en los entrenamientos y en combate, ocupándose de los moribundos y fortaleciendo la fe de los vivos.\n\nComo todos los capellanes imperiales, hizo un voto de no luchar jamás. Sin embargo, actuó como médico y trataba a los heridos.

RoyalGuard51.title: guardia real
RoyalGuard51.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] vigilaba el palacio privado de un poderoso señor.\n\nAunque la violencia era escasa, la intriga palaciega era constante. El trabajo de [PAWN_nameDef] le enseñó a manejarse con las palabras y las armas.

Propagandist86.title: propagandista
Propagandist86.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue un talentoso artista y propagandista militar. Creaba obras de arte que representaban a nobles y ejércitos de manera favorable.

ShipBoy89.title: niño de navío
ShipBoy89.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] nació de sirvientes de bajo rango en un antiguo navío estelar. La IA de la nave fue como un tercer padre para [PAWN_objective], y los miembros de la tripulación que fabricaban repuestos fueron como una segunda familia.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] apenas contempló plantas o animales, y su tacto le sigue pareciendo desconcertante.

MilitaryCadet46.title: cadete militar
MilitaryCadet46.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue llamado(a) a filas a una edad muy joven para ser soldado. Vivió en barracones con otros niños soldados, aprendiendo sobre el deber, las armas, el dolor, y la victoria.\n\nLos instructores permitían algunas veces a los chicos escapar de la base para disfrutar del mundo. Querían soldados que pudieran pensar con independencia.

PoliticalCaptive7.title: cautivo político
PoliticalCaptive7.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue raptado(a) por una familia rival y mantenido(a) como rehén. Para pausar su tiempo en cautiverio, leía libros y practicaba artes marciales. [PAWN_nameDef] tuvo pocas oportunidades para desarrollar sus habilidades sociales.

Delinquent13.title: delincuente
Delinquent13.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] pasó la mayor parte de su infancia tras las rejas. Tras un infructuoso intento de fuga, fue obligado(a) a entrar en el ejército.

RichKid61.title: niño rico
RichKid61.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] venía de una rica e influyente estirpe. Su cara educación incluyó lecciones de duelo, liderazgo, y estrategia militar.

StreetRat81.title: rata callejera
StreetRat81.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] formaba parte de una banda de rateros. Pasó sus días vaciando bolsillos, metido en disputas territoriales, o puesto de cualquier droga en la que pudiera poner las manos.

SoldiersKid55.title: niño soldado
SoldiersKid55.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] creció en el antiguo navío estelar donde sus padres estaban estacionados. Aprendió lo básico de operaciones con armas de fuego y mantenimiento de los soldados de a bordo. [PAWN_nameDef] se acostumbró a la estricta rutina y a la disciplina frecuente.

Machinist56.title: maquinista
Machinist56.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] tenía aptitudes para la maquinaria. Ayudaba al presupuesto familiar reparando y modificando armas en el mercado negro.

Warmaster54.title: maestro de guerra
Warmaster54.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue [PAWN_pronoun] maestro(a) de guerra de una casa noble de estirpe media. [PAWN_pronoun] supervisaba aspectos militares de estrategia para la familia.\n\nEn la rara ocasión en que se daba una batalla, [PAWN_nameDef] daba las órdenes militares.

Regent9.title: regente
Regent9.desc: Cuando el aliado de la familia de [PAWN_nameDef] fue asesinado, y su joven hijo heredó el trono, [PAWN_nameDef] fue designado(a) como regente para gobernar en su nombre.\n\nSupervisó diversas cuestiones relativas a la casa y al título, desde las finanzas y la guerra hasta los intentos de familiares avariciosos por usurpar el trono. [PAWN_nameDef] jamás abusó de su posición.

Beastmaster67.title: señor de las bestias
Beastmaster67.desc: La familia de [PAWN_nameDef] tuvo más hijos que cantidad de títulos a repartir. Estando abajo en la línea de sucesión, a [PAWN_nameDef] se le dio el título honorario de señor/a de las bestias.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] se ocupó de la enorme casa de fieras de su familia. Aunque nunca trabajó activamente con las bestias, conectaba con ellas. Pocos [PAWN_objective] apreciaron en el modo en que los animales lo hicieron.

ArtsPatron54.title: patrón de las artes
ArtsPatron54.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] manejaba las inversiones de su familia en las artes.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] elegía a qué artitas patrocinar y trabajaba junto a ellos para producir las expresiones que mejor glorificarían a su familia, a la iglesia Imperial y al propio Imperio.

Spymaster41.title: maestro de espías
Spymaster41.desc: Tan pronto como fue lo bastante mayor, a [PAWN_nameDef] le fue dado el puesto de maestro(a) de espías por su familia. Su naturaleza fría y calculadora le dio capacidades naturales en las artes del apuñalamiento, el veneno y la traición.

Landworker98.title: capataz
Landworker98.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] poseía la posición de capataz en su noble casa. [PAWN_pronoun] administraba las tierras de la familia y todos sus recursos - tanto agrícolas como minerales.\n\nAunque nunca trabajó directamente con las máquinas, el ocuparse de estas empresas le hizo aprender los métodos de la agricultura y la minería al detalle.

CountryLordling92.title: señor del campo
CountryLordling92.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] creció en la mansión de una familia noble en un territorio alejado. Sus primeros años estuvieron dedicados a lecciones de equitación, política, y religión.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] y sus amigos encontraron muchas formas de romper las reglas y divertirse en las áreas campestres y forestales.

UrbanLordling82.title: señor de la urbe
UrbanLordling82.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] nació en el seno de una casa noble con una mansión en una gran ciudad. Pasó su juventud inmerso(a) en lecciones de política.\n\nSiempre que podía, se escapaba con sus amigos para explorar las sub-estructuras a medio construir de la metropólis.

ShipboundLordling12.title: señor de la nave
ShipboundLordling12.desc: La familia de [PAWN_nameDef] ejercía su poder desde una gran y ancestral nave estelar. Nacido(a) y criado(a) en la nave, [PAWN_nameDef] aprendió todo sobre los rigores de la vida a bordo, y la política y los métodos de la batalla interestelar y la invasión orbital.\n\nAprendió a sentirse como en casa entre robustas paredes herméticas y el gentil siseo de los regulares atmosféricos.

PamperedLordling37.title: señorito consentido
PamperedLordling37.desc: Los padres de [PAWN_nameDef] no querían otro heredero. Temiendo una lucha de sucesión, decidieron neutralir[PAWN_objective] bien temprano.\n\n[PAWN_objective] mimaron desde su nacimiento, impidiéndo[PAWN_objective] desarrollar el coraje o el conocimiento necesarios para ser una amenaza a su hijo favorito. [PAWN_nameDef] aprendió poco más que a manipular al servicio para conseguir más comida.

UnwantedSurvivor67.title: superviviente no deseado
UnwantedSurvivor67.desc: La noble familia de [PAWN_nameDef] no [PAWN_objective] quería, pero tampoco podían permitirse que su eliminación saliese a la luz. Trataron de asesinar[PAWN_objective] obligándo[PAWN_objective] a pasar por un peligroso entrenamiento sin la adecuada protección a una muy temprana edad.\n\nContra todo pronóstico, [PAWN_nameDef] sobrevivió a los torneos de justas, las luchas a caballos, las competiciones en río bravo y las zonas de guerra. Al final, sólo se hizo más fuerte.

NavyScientist52.title: científico de la armada
NavyScientist52.desc: La guerra interestelar se gana con tecnología, así que las armadas de los mundos brillantes están siemprea la vanguardia de la investigación. Más aún, son los primeros en tener acceso a artefactos arqueotécnicos, al hallarlos en el espacio.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba en un laboratorio de la armada.

GlitterworldEmpath26.title: émpata de mundo brillante
GlitterworldEmpath26.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] tenía una asombrosa habilidad para relacionarse con otros y mediar en conflictos. Fue seleccionado para entrenar como émpata. El adiestramiento intensificó sus habilidades naturales, pero le imposibilitó llegar a dañar a los demás.

GlitterworldSurgeon15.title: cirujano de mundo brillante
GlitterworldSurgeon15.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajaba como cirujano(a) en un mundo predominantemente libre de enfermedad y sufrimiento humano.\n\nSu trabajo consistía principalmente en elaboradas y creativas cirugías coesméticas. [PAWN_pronoun] posee un buen entendimiento de la biología humana, pero nunca tuvo que extirpar un cáncer - o una bala.

Novelist7.title: novelista
Novelist7.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] vivía en un mundo brillante, escribiendo novelas de gran éxito. Vivía una vida sin preocupaciones, empleando sus días en escribir y sus noches de fiesta - y nunca realizó una sola labor manual en su vida.

CharityWorker36.title: trabajador de caridad
CharityWorker36.desc: Los mundos brillantes son paraísos de seguridad y comodidad para aquellos con la suerte de vivir allí, pero [PAWN_nameDef] no podía ignorar los planetas cercanos donde la gente malvivía a causa de la pobreza. [PAWN_pronoun] pasó su vida laboral reuniendo docaciones y ayudando a los necesitados.

GlitterworldOfficer60.title: oficial de mundo brillante
GlitterworldOfficer60.desc: Aunque los mundos brillantes son lugares pacíficos, suelen estar preparados para la guerra. La unidad de [PAWN_nameDef] rara vez contempló la acción real.\n\nAunque [PAWN_pronoun] tenía aficiones artísticas, sus subordinados preferían entretenerse peleando, de modo que [PAWN_nameDef] mejoró mucho aprendiendo a detener peleas.

BiosphereManager95.title: mánager de biosfera
BiosphereManager95.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] vivía en un pacífico mundo brillante donde todo el trabajo doméstico era realizado por robots y la gente se dedicaba al ocio. [PAWN_pronoun] mantenía la flora y la fauna de un parque en crecimiento, donde los ciudadanos iban a admirar la belleza natural.

VRDesigner87.title: diseñador de RV
VRDesigner87.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] diseñaba simuladores de realidad virtual para los ciudadanos de mundos brillantes. Prestaba gran atención a los detalles de sus mundos, incluyendo todo lo que podía sobre la flora para hacer las experiencias más realistas.

Architect28.title: arquitecto
Architect28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] diseñaba y erigía edificios. En su mundo brillante natal, la mayoría de los aspectos técnicos de la arquitectura los realizaba una IA. Esto le permitió explotar los límites artísticos de su oficio, pero también implicó no tener que mancharse nunca las manos para construir.

Sculptor63.title: escultor
Sculptor63.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] se inició esculpiendo estatuas de piedra de tamaño humano, pero pronto empezó a pensar a lo grande. Con la ayuda de robots mineros, aprendió a tallar monumentos enormes en paredes de acantilados. Pronto los parques naturales del mundo brillante donde [PAWN_pronoun] estuvieron llenos de figuras gigantes de roca.

MedievalFarmOaf58.title: patán de granja medieval
MedievalFarmOaf58.desc: Labrar, escardar, guiar carros de bueyes, empujar carretillas. Cavar zanjas, plantar semillas, predecir la cosella.\n\nLos granjeros de nivel medieval no son educados en el sentido habitual, pero saben mucho sobre cultivar plantas sin tecnología. Una vez dicho esto, tal vida impide esencialmente el participar en actividades intelectuales basadas en la tecnología.

MedievalLord57.title: señor medieval
MedievalLord57.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] era un noble en un planeta pre-industrial. Asistía a fiestas, dirigía a sus subordinados, e incluso aprendió algo de esgrima.\n\nSus manos suaves no sujetaron una herramienta de trabajo en todo ese tiempo. Considera la labor manual por debajo de [PAWN_pronoun].

MedievalMinstrel95.title: juglar medieval
MedievalMinstrel95.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fue un artista errante en un mundo medieval.\n\nSe le podía encontrar siempre contando historias o cantando canciones, y es capaz de protegerse de los peligros de los caminos. Sin embargo, siempre estuvo notablemente ausente cada vez que había arduas labores que llevar a cabo.

Taster16.title: catador
Taster16.desc: Como catador/a de un rey medieval, todo plato servido en la mesa real tenía que ser probado primero por [PAWN_nameDef]. [PAWN_pronoun] vivió un decadente estilo de vida en la corte, engordando y haciendo muy poco trabajo.

Blacksmith72.title: herrero
Blacksmith72.desc: Como herrero(a) de un mundo medieval, [PAWN_nameDef] se ganó una reputación debido a la alta calidad de su trabajo. Tampoco se le daba mal usar las espadas que [PAWN_pronoun] mismo(a) forjaba.

MessageCarrier77.title: portador de mensajes
MessageCarrier77.desc: En un mundo medieval, la manera más rápida de enviar un mensaje es dárselo a alguien a caballo y rezar por que sobreviva al viaje. [PAWN_nameDef] era ese alguien.

MedievalDoctor40.title: médico medieval
MedievalDoctor40.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] trabajó como médico en un planeta medieval. Cree firmemente que la mayoría de las dolencias pueden curarse con una pequeña sangría.\n\nFue también un/una maestro(a) anestesista, desarrollando una técnica especial que comprendía un fuerte porrazo en la cabeza.

Herbalist54.title: herbolario
Herbalist54.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] vivía en un bosque cerca de una aldea. Aunque muchos de los aldeanos le temían, los que caían enfermos venían a [PAWN_pronoun] en búsqueda de ungüentos y cataplasmas hechos con las hierbas que cultivaba en su jardín. [PAWN_pronoun] se sentía feliz de poder ayudarlos - por un precio.

MedievalSailor97.title: marino medieval
MedievalSailor97.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] exploraba los océanos en un barco de madera, tratando de localizar especímenes de flora y fauna en lugares exóticos, y ocasionalmente defendiéndose de piratas. Amaba tanto el mar que rechazó casi hasta el más mínimo trabajo en tierra, excepto vender los tesoros que encontraba.

MedievalSlave49.title: esclavo medieval
MedievalSlave49.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] creció tirando de carretas y cavando zanjas en un mundo medieval. El trabajo manual simple es su más vieja compañía - junto a los latigazos de su amo.\n\nNo aprendió a leer hasta los nueve años.

MedievalLordling19.title: señor medieval
MedievalLordling19.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] era un noble menor de un viejo reino en un mundo medieval. Creció en una mansión hecha de piedra, servido por personas de clase más baja.\n\nUna vida así no enseña habilidades técnicas, e inculca una aversión permanente a la labor manual - pero [PAWN_nameDef] aprendió pronto las artes de la manipulación social.

ConventChild16.title: chico del convento
ConventChild16.desc: El fruto de una relación ilícita, [PAWN_nameDef] fue criado(a) por las monjas de un convento medieval. Aprendió el valor del trabajo duro y la sumisión, pero se le enseñó que la tecnología era una herejía.

Policeman45.title: policía
Policeman45.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] mantenía la paz y el orden como oficial de una fuerza municipal de policía.\n\nFue entrenado(a) en resolución de conflictos, control de la situación, tiro al blanco, y otras habilidades de policía.

Chef52.title: chef
Chef52.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] dirigía un restaurante de categoría. Era famoso(a) entre los patrocinadores por sus creativas especialidades culinarias, e igualmente infame entre los trabajadores de la cocina por su habitual desdén hacia el trabajo cabrón.

Housemate8.title: housemate
Housemate8.desc: As an adult, [PAWN_nameDef] kept house and cared for children while [PAWN_possessive] spouse worked.

Inventor6.title: inventor
Inventor6.desc: On [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a moderately successful inventor. [PAWN_pronoun] developed several minor technologies.

Teacher20.title: teacher
Teacher20.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was educated in the liberal arts and taught at a public school. [PAWN_pronoun] was widely knowledgeable and well-liked by [PAWN_possessive] students.

CivilServant2.title: civil servant
CivilServant2.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a low-ranking administrator for a moribund government bureaucracy. [PAWN_pronoun] is most at home filling out complicated paperwork and playing office politics.

Bartender62.title: bartender
Bartender62.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a bartender in a seedy establishment. The job was one part drink-mixing, one part diplomacy, and one part head-bashing.

ConceptualArtist39.title: conceptual artist
ConceptualArtist39.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was well-known in art circles on [PAWN_possessive] home world for [PAWN_possessive] unique and creative conceptual artworks.\n\nNobody was sure exactly what [PAWN_pronoun] was trying to communicate, but [PAWN_possessive] pieces were highly valued by collectors.

Evangelist39.title: evangelist
Evangelist39.desc: As a youth, [PAWN_nameDef] experienced a religious awakening. [PAWN_pronoun] decided to spend the rest of [PAWN_possessive] life spreading the word of [PAWN_possessive] deity, the beauty of its culture, and its unusual medical tradition.

AsceticPriest84.title: ascetic priest
AsceticPriest84.desc: After taking a vow of silence, [PAWN_nameDef] joined a monastery to spend [PAWN_possessive] days in quiet contemplation.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] found happiness growing vegetables in the garden and making cheese in the monastery cellars.

EscapedConvict90.title: escaped convict
EscapedConvict90.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] denies involvement in the crimes that brought about [PAWN_possessive] incarceration in a brutal penal colony. [PAWN_pronoun] escaped by tunneling beneath the perimeter using modified cutlery.

Nurse61.title: nurse
Nurse61.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in a hospital, doing routine work such as changing bandages and taking temperatures.\n\nIt was a busy job, but [PAWN_pronoun] could always find time for a chat with a patient.

HouseServant63.title: house servant
HouseServant63.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a domestic servant to wealthy homeowners.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] got to know the kitchens and basements of [PAWN_possessive] master's mansion well, but never did any work outside.

Bodyguard58.title: bodyguard
Bodyguard58.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] protected whoever paid [PAWN_objective]. [PAWN_pronoun] gained proficiency in many different combat forms, and was known for [PAWN_possessive] ruthlessness against those who crossed [PAWN_objective].

Mathematician6.title: mathematician
Mathematician6.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] did mathematical research at a university.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] spent much of [PAWN_possessive] spare time immersed in shooting simulations, though [PAWN_pronoun] was frequently ridiculed by other players for [PAWN_possessive] terrible aim.

Paramedic45.title: paramedic
Paramedic45.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s job was to respond rapidly to medical emergencies. [PAWN_pronoun] is used to dealing with severe injuries with only limited medical supplies.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] treated so many gunshot wounds over the years that even seeing a gun made [PAWN_objective] uncomfortable.

Gardener99.title: gardener
Gardener99.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked at the mansion of a powerful family, tending the lavish gardens as part of a team of servants.

Torturer37.title: torturer
Torturer37.desc: Working for a tyrannical dictator, [PAWN_nameDef] earned a reputation as an expert in 'persuasion.' Any prisoner who went down into the dungeons left with no secrets - and with [PAWN_nameDef]'s smile scarred permanently into their nightmares.

Defector78.title: defector
Defector78.desc: Early in [PAWN_possessive] adulthood, [PAWN_nameDef] decided to leave the oppressive dictatorship where [PAWN_pronoun] lived. [PAWN_possessive] defection was not well-received, and agents were sent out after [PAWN_objective].\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] spent years on the run, treating [PAWN_possessive] own wounds so no doctor could betray [PAWN_objective]. The ordeal made [PAWN_objective] bitter and untrusting.

ConstructionEngineer32.title: construction engineer
ConstructionEngineer32.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a construction worker. [PAWN_pronoun] lead a team which built everything from office blocks to cathedrals.\n\n[PAWN_possessive] busy job and numerous nearby fast-food outlets meant [PAWN_pronoun] never cooked for [PAWN_objective]self.

Rancher43.title: rancher
Rancher43.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] owned and operated a successful ranch where [PAWN_pronoun] raised animals for meat and wool.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] refused to do any dumb labour [PAWN_pronoun] could pay someone else to do for [PAWN_objective].

LowWageWorker7.title: low-wage worker
LowWageWorker7.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked a variety of casual jobs to support [PAWN_possessive] family, gaining a set of basic hands-on skills.

Model99.title: model
Model99.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] modelled clothes and jewellery for advertisers, and was also used as a physical blueprint for characters in virtual reality simulations.

Geologist66.title: geologist
Geologist66.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked with miners and cave-diggers, identifying rock types and natural formations.\n\nDuring [PAWN_possessive] years underground [PAWN_pronoun] also gained experience repairing drilling machines and other technical equipment.

Jailbird40.title: jailbird
Jailbird40.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] life in prisons, where [PAWN_pronoun] was put to work in the kitchens. [PAWN_pronoun] had a habit of getting into fights, and developed an aggressive way of speaking.

Actor72.title: actor
Actor72.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] travelled with a company of actors, playing to packed theatres and loving audiences everywhere. [PAWN_pronoun] was a perfectionist, and made [PAWN_possessive] own props and costumes rather than use the ones [PAWN_pronoun] was given.

Veterinarian99.title: veterinarian
Veterinarian99.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] treated sick and injured animals for a living. Seeing their suffering affected [PAWN_possessive] stance on the practice of eating meat, and for many years [PAWN_pronoun] lived as a vegetarian.

ExplosivesExpert26.title: explosives expert
ExplosivesExpert26.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was an explosive engineer employed in mines. [PAWN_pronoun] took [PAWN_possessive] job very seriously and was well-versed in the technicalities - so much so that [PAWN_pronoun] refused to demean [PAWN_objective]self by helping with the clean-up once [PAWN_possessive] carefully-calculated explosion was complete.

Counselor26.title: counselor
Counselor26.desc: A terrifying trauma when [PAWN_nameDef] was a young adult caused [PAWN_objective] to develop a serious eating disorder. With counseling [PAWN_pronoun] learned to have a healthier relationship with food, and decided to put [PAWN_possessive] new skills to use helping others overcome their emotional problems.

Recruiter4.title: recruiter
Recruiter4.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was part of an revered order of martial artists, infamous both for their skill in combat and for their practice of refusing to treat their wounded.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] travelled [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, judging the young people [PAWN_pronoun] met to determine if they might be suitable for training.

Drifter67.title: drifter
Drifter67.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] never figured out what to do with [PAWN_possessive] life. [PAWN_pronoun] travelled often, taking up casual work wherever [PAWN_pronoun] found it.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] also occasionally worked on a novel that [PAWN_pronoun] knew would be a bestseller - just as soon as [PAWN_pronoun] could find a publisher who was interested.

MachineCollector55.title: machine collector
MachineCollector55.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was obsessed with old machines and arcane pieces of technology. [PAWN_pronoun] obtained them wherever [PAWN_pronoun] could, and loved taking them apart to see how they worked.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] had a habit of talking about [PAWN_possessive] collection long after people around [PAWN_objective] had stopped listening.

ConArtist80.title: con artist
ConArtist80.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] never created anything in [PAWN_possessive] life. [PAWN_pronoun] did, however, prove to be a natural at getting others to give [PAWN_objective] what they had created.

VatgrownSoldier8.title: vatgrown soldier
VatgrownSoldier8.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] wasn't made as a person, but as an instrument of destruction. Grown in a bioweapons facility and taught combat during [PAWN_possessive] accelerated growth, [PAWN_nameDef] still has a proclivity for combat of all kinds and an aversion to human contact.

SicklyChild55.title: sickly child
SicklyChild55.desc: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] suffered from a rare disease. Quarantined in a hospital, [PAWN_pronoun] had minimal human contact and got little physical exercise. In the sterile hospital environment, however, [PAWN_pronoun] became very familiar with science and medicine.

FrightenedChild43.title: frightened child
FrightenedChild43.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up with a laundry list of phobias and neuroses. [PAWN_pronoun] feared, among other things, doctors and foodborne pathogens.\n\nAs a result, [PAWN_pronoun] learned to cook and care for [PAWN_objective]self, but many of [PAWN_possessive] fears dog [PAWN_objective] in adulthood.

ComaChild57.title: coma child
ComaChild57.desc: A childhood accident put [PAWN_nameDef] into a coma. [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t wake up until [PAWN_pronoun] was in [PAWN_possessive] late teens. [PAWN_possessive] body never recovered from the years of inactivity, but people tend to take pity on [PAWN_objective] when they hear [PAWN_possessive] story.

Pyromaniac18.title: pyromaniac
Pyromaniac18.desc: From an early age, [PAWN_nameDef] had an unhealthy fascination with fire. [PAWN_pronoun] would set refuse heaps ablaze and become so entranced by the flames [PAWN_pronoun] would absent-mindedly burn [PAWN_objective]self.\n\nOne day while playing with matches, [PAWN_pronoun] carelessly burned down [PAWN_possessive] home.

Mute34.title: mute
Mute34.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was greatly affected by a traumatic event early in [PAWN_possessive] life. For many years [PAWN_pronoun] refused to speak to people, preferring instead to play with [PAWN_possessive] household's numerous pets.

WarRefugee51.title: war refugee
WarRefugee51.desc: War broke out in [PAWN_nameDef]'s home when [PAWN_pronoun] was a baby. [PAWN_possessive] parents fled with [PAWN_objective], seeking safety wherever they could find it. [PAWN_nameDef]'s earliest memories are of being taught how to defend [PAWN_objective]self.\n\nThe violence and destruction [PAWN_pronoun] witnessed left [PAWN_objective] scarred for life.

MusicalKid86.title: musical kid
MusicalKid86.desc: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] had a talent for playing musical instruments and singing. [PAWN_pronoun] was given expert training and loved to perform in recitals and concerts, though the lavish praise [PAWN_pronoun] received made [PAWN_objective] a little self-obsessed.

ChildStar74.title: child star
ChildStar74.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was well-known throughout [PAWN_possessive] homeworld as a child actor in films and TV shows. [PAWN_possessive] fame put [PAWN_objective] in contact with many different kinds of people, but also tended to get in the way of [PAWN_possessive] education.

ChildSpy47.title: child spy
ChildSpy47.desc: Children are presumed innocent, which makes them excellent spies. [PAWN_nameDef] was trained in the art of infiltration when [PAWN_pronoun] was just a small child.\n\n[PAWN_possessive] years undercover gave [PAWN_objective] experience with social manipulation and lying, but [PAWN_pronoun] never had a normal education.

ShopKid36.title: shop kid
ShopKid36.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s mother was often ill, and it fell to [PAWN_objective] to run the store which was their only source of income. [PAWN_pronoun] learned a little about the exotic artifacts which [PAWN_pronoun] sold, and a lot about the art of the deal.

OrganFarm67.title: organ farm
OrganFarm67.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was raised in an illegal underground organ farm. [PAWN_possessive] body was used to grow organic implants for wounded mercenaries. Though [PAWN_possessive] upbringing has left [PAWN_objective] haunted, it has also given [PAWN_objective] a unique understanding of human biology.

MedicalAssistant12.title: medical assistant
MedicalAssistant12.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born during a catastrophic war in which both sides used incendiary weapons. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up helping [PAWN_possessive] parents in an infirmary, treating the cascade of horrific burns from the battlefields. [PAWN_pronoun] was left with a lifelong fear of fire.

CultChild3.title: cult child
CultChild3.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into a powerful cult which shunned advanced technology and believed that all illness could be cured by cleansing the soul through sacred art.\n\nAfter [PAWN_possessive] first glimpse of the outside world, [PAWN_pronoun] decided to run away.

StoryWriter67.title: story writer
StoryWriter67.desc: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] was addicted to reading. [PAWN_pronoun] would spend all day in [PAWN_possessive] local library with [PAWN_possessive] nose in a book. When budget cuts forced the library to close, [PAWN_nameDef] was distraught. [PAWN_pronoun] decided to fill the gap by writing [PAWN_possessive] own stories instead.

FactoryWorker58.title: factory worker
FactoryWorker58.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] did menial, unskilled work in an industrial factory. [PAWN_possessive] job also included caring for the mules and horses which transported the goods.

PsychiatricPatient94.title: psychiatric patient
PsychiatricPatient94.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] adult life in an insane asylum. [PAWN_possessive] industrial homeworld had a poor understanding of mental illness, and [PAWN_pronoun] was treated more like an animal than a person.\n\nThough [PAWN_pronoun] eventually recovered and was released, [PAWN_possessive] experience dampened many of [PAWN_possessive] basic life skills.

HumanComputer83.title: human computer
HumanComputer83.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] turned out to have an excellent memory and a gift for performing complex calculations in [PAWN_possessive] head. An industrial-world dictator decided to employ [PAWN_nameDef] to keep track of [PAWN_possessive] state's finances and expenditure.

Sheriff52.title: sheriff
Sheriff52.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the law enforcer in an isolated industrial town. [PAWN_pronoun] dealt with petty crime, dispute resolution, and the occasional drunken saloon shootout.

UrbworldEntrepreneur14.title: urbworld entrepreneur
UrbworldEntrepreneur14.desc: In the urbworlds, most suffer. But someone has to run the corporations.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] learned the skills of the trade - greasing palms and technical analysis. [PAWN_pronoun] is a sociointellectual machine.

JoywireArtist8.title: joywire artist
JoywireArtist8.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in an urbworld lab developing cutting-edge joywire software to maximize user pleasure.\n\nWhen the local government imposed harsh restrictions on joywire manufacturing, [PAWN_pronoun] began selling [PAWN_possessive] products on the black market.

MafiaBoss17.title: mafia boss
MafiaBoss17.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a high-ranking member of an urbworld crime syndicate.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] bribed officials, maintained the loyalty of [PAWN_possessive] subordinates, and extracted overdue payments - by any means necessary.

UrbworldDrone32.title: urbworld drone
UrbworldDrone32.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a mindless construction drone on a massive urbworld. Though [PAWN_pronoun] is now freed from the brutal social experiments to which [PAWN_pronoun] was subjected, [PAWN_pronoun] remains incapable of creative thought and leadership.

UrbworldRebel56.title: urbworld rebel
UrbworldRebel56.desc: Most of the people on [PAWN_nameDef]'s world gave up their individuality to join together in an online hivemind. [PAWN_nameDef] joined a rebel faction that rejected technology entirely.

CaveworldIlluminator23.title: caveworld illuminator
CaveworldIlluminator23.desc: Among tunnel-dwellers, those with vision as strong as [PAWN_nameDef]’s are revered as sages. [PAWN_pronoun] would lead the way, marking spots to dig with bioluminescent fungus and warning others of impending danger.

ColonySettler53.title: colony settler
ColonySettler53.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a settler on a new colony world.\n\nSuch a life requires a jack-of-all trades at basic hands-on tasks.

DeepSpaceMiner3.title: deep space miner
DeepSpaceMiner3.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] did the sweaty, grimy work of pulling metal out of asteroids on a deep space rig. [PAWN_pronoun] used [PAWN_possessive] hands-on industrial skills daily - and wasn't bad in a bar fight either.

StarshipJanitor33.title: starship janitor
StarshipJanitor33.desc: While other passengers pass the years between star systems in cryptosleep sarcophagi, [PAWN_nameDef] had to wake up at periodic intervals to perform inspections, check the navigation systems, and to oil the mechanoids.

Castaway57.title: castaway
Castaway57.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the only survivor of a ship crash on an unhabited animal world. For many years until [PAWN_possessive] rescue [PAWN_pronoun] scrounged an existence out of whatever [PAWN_pronoun] could find.\n\n[PAWN_possessive] survival skills became razor-sharp, but spending so long alone severely dampened [PAWN_possessive] conversatial abilities.

Taxonomist0.title: taxonomist
Taxonomist0.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] travelled between star systems, studying and classifying the plant and animal life [PAWN_pronoun] found in the hopes of creating a complete catalogue.

SpaceTactician28.title: space tactician
SpaceTactician28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] joined the space navy in an unstable system, fraught with large-scale interplanetary wars. [PAWN_pronoun] turned out to have a sharp mind for battle, and became adept at commanding combat units to great effect.

IndustrialOrphan13.title: industrial orphan
IndustrialOrphan13.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] never knew [PAWN_possessive] parents. [PAWN_possessive] earliest memories were of drudgery in the mines and workhouses of [PAWN_possessive] industrial world.\n\nBecause of this, [PAWN_pronoun] never received a proper education.

UrbworldUrchin61.title: urbworld urchin
UrbworldUrchin61.desc: The urbworlds - ancient and deep industrial cityscapes bursting with humanity and poison. [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in the dark, unwanted reaches of such a place. [PAWN_pronoun] had to fight for every scrap of food.

TestSubject15.title: test subject
TestSubject15.desc: On the most corrupt urbworlds, scientists without a moral compass commit unspeakable atrocities in the name of research. [PAWN_nameDef] was kept alone in a sealed facility from birth and subjected to a variety of behavioural experiments in an attempt to turn [PAWN_objective] into a perfect super-soldier.

WreckageExplorer93.title: wreckage explorer
WreckageExplorer93.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was tasked with watching [PAWN_possessive] family's herds, but often shirked [PAWN_possessive] duties to go exploring the crashed warships scattered around the planet.

ApocalypseSurvivor23.title: apocalypse survivor
ApocalypseSurvivor23.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born during a time of unrest on [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, as climate change threatened mass starvation and flooding. As [PAWN_pronoun] grew up the situation worsened - billions died and peaceful states descended into anarchy. [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] parents did whatever they had to to survive.

CaveworldTender20.title: caveworld tender
CaveworldTender20.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in cave complex deep beneath the surface of an inhospitable world. [PAWN_pronoun] worked with the other children tending the tribe’s fungus crops.

CaveworldTunneler48.title: caveworld tunneler
CaveworldTunneler48.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a digger in the massive underground cave complex.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] knows rock so well that [PAWN_pronoun] can almost navigate caves by smell.

Scout44.title: scout
Scout44.desc: Born to the administrators of a rimworld colony, [PAWN_nameDef] was enrolled in a youth program that taught military scouting skills.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] learned to survive in the wilderness, to obey, and not to ask questions.

ShelterChild50.title: shelter child
ShelterChild50.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a shelter deep beneath a toxic world. [PAWN_pronoun] received a comprehensive education, but had no opportunity to do physical labour.

Hermit82.title: hermit
Hermit82.desc: Worn out by the pressures of social interaction, [PAWN_nameDef] left [PAWN_possessive] crowded city to live a simple life in the wilderness. There, [PAWN_pronoun] spent [PAWN_possessive] days alone, tending [PAWN_possessive] garden and crafting the simple tools [PAWN_pronoun] needed to survive.

SpacePirate55.title: space pirate
SpacePirate55.desc: Piracy appears everywhere that governments are weak and society spread thin. [PAWN_nameDef] was part of this age-old part of human existence, extorting and smashing peaceful trade ships for profit.

PitBrawler76.title: pit brawler
PitBrawler76.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was nine years old when [PAWN_pronoun] got in [PAWN_possessive] first fight. [PAWN_pronoun] won, but more important was the enjoyment of [PAWN_possessive] audience. Pit fighting turned out to be a lucrative career for those who could survive it. And it was even mostly legal.

IllegalShipwright76.title: illegal shipwright
IllegalShipwright76.desc: There is a law that says that you're not allowed to put terawatt-range grasers on a cargo scow. Especially if you hide them under what looks like a communications dish for better ambush potential. [PAWN_nameDef] discovered that there is great profit to be made, however, from those who are uninterested in these laws.

Gigolo30.title: gigolo
Gigolo30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was used for [PAWN_possessive] body by hundreds of customers in brothels on several planets. [PAWN_pronoun] gained some mental marks and a special kind of street smarts.

SpaceMarine16.title: space marine
SpaceMarine16.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a warrior in an Imperial navy. [PAWN_possessive] job was to punch into enemy starships, gun down the crew, and capture the ship intact. And [PAWN_pronoun] was good at it.

Assassin20.title: assassin
Assassin20.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a professional assassin. [PAWN_pronoun] was cold, calculating, and made a good profit. In this business, an utter lack of empathy was an asset.

Hunter74.title: hunter
Hunter74.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] tracked, trapped and killed animals for their meat and leather.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] used both ranged and melee weapons. Sometimes, [PAWN_pronoun] hunted alongside animals.

Logger16.title: logger
Logger16.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] chopped trees and hauled their lumber back to the tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] wielded [PAWN_possessive] axe with the finesse of an artist and the force of a charging muffalo.

Gatherer70.title: gatherer
Gatherer70.desc: Using [PAWN_possessive] knowledge of plants, roots, and berries, [PAWN_nameDef] could find food in even the most barren landscapes. [PAWN_pronoun] stayed away from animals.

Digger66.title: digger
Digger66.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] carved living spaces and mined minerals from the sides of hills and mountains. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to feel at home picking through rock and shoring up cave walls.

Weaver63.title: weaver
Weaver63.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was an expert at working wool, plant fibers and natural dyes into beautiful clothing for [PAWN_possessive] kin. [PAWN_possessive] handicrafts were traded frequently with other settlements.

Framer37.title: framer
Framer37.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was responsible for erecting structures for [PAWN_possessive] fellow tribespeople to live in. This included both temporary structures for nomadic travel, and permanent settlements. Gathering building materials from local plant life was part of the job.

StewKeeper95.title: stew keeper
StewKeeper95.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] prepared meals from the plants and animals brought in by gatherers, farmers, and hunters of [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] had to make sure it was calorie-efficient, long-lasting, and healthy. [PAWN_pronoun] often processed and sometime gathered plants [PAWN_objective]self.

Tamer79.title: tamer
Tamer79.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s role in [PAWN_possessive] tribe was to connect with the natural world around - especially the world of animals. In addition to fulfilling a spiritual role, [PAWN_pronoun] also tamed wild beasts and cared for them as they served the tribe.

Carver1.title: carver
Carver1.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] carved artworks for [PAWN_possessive] tribe from wood, stone, and occasionally, more exotic materials. The work was sometimes sold, and sometimes kept to beautify settlements and provide a focus for rituals.

Healer0.title: healer
Healer0.desc: After [PAWN_possessive] tribe’s elder healer was killed in a raid, [PAWN_nameDef] took on the role. [PAWN_pronoun] spent [PAWN_possessive] days scrounging up herbs and mineral compounds from the nearby area to use in surprisingly effective remedies.

HearthTender66.title: hearth tender
HearthTender66.desc: While the others were out hunting and foraging, [PAWN_nameDef] would stay at home to cook and take care of the young and sick.

Warrior94.title: warrior
Warrior94.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a fearsome warrior, proficient with many weapons. [PAWN_pronoun] participated in many battles.

Archer25.title: archer
Archer25.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] fought for [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] and specialized in the use of bows, pila, and other ranged weapons.

Brave88.title: brave
Brave88.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] wielded ikwa, axes, clubs, and other close-ranged weapons in battles for [PAWN_possessive] tribe.

Scout59.title: scout
Scout59.desc: Since [PAWN_possessive] tribe made contact with local outlanders, [PAWN_nameDef] contracted [PAWN_possessive] services out as a guide. Frequent contact with ancient technology made [PAWN_objective] comfortable with the lost machines.

VengefulHunter32.title: vengeful hunter
VengefulHunter32.desc: Following the death of a close friend by animal attack, [PAWN_nameDef] hunted the beast responsible. [PAWN_pronoun] tracked it to a nearby village, only to find one of the villagers wearing its pelt.

MuffaloShaman95.title: muffalo shaman
MuffaloShaman95.desc: Because of [PAWN_possessive] quiet wisdom and great strength, [PAWN_nameDef] became the spiritual guide for [PAWN_possessive] tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] had a special connection with the great spirit of the muffalo.

LoreKeeper51.title: lore keeper
LoreKeeper51.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of a long line of lore keepers in [PAWN_possessive] tribe. Every night around the fire, [PAWN_pronoun] would pass on ancient knowledge and helpful wisdom through stories.

Loner61.title: loner
Loner61.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] never much liked the tribal council or the yearly festivals. [PAWN_pronoun] preferred the open plain and the whistle of wind through the rocks.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] visited [PAWN_possessive] tribe from time to time, but mostly took care of [PAWN_objective]self using [PAWN_possessive] own survival skills.

Banished68.title: banished
Banished68.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s tribe banished [PAWN_objective] following a bloody dispute. [PAWN_pronoun] survived in the wilds alone for a long time.

Malingerer28.title: malingerer
Malingerer28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] often feigned sickness in order to avoid [PAWN_possessive] responsibilities. While resting in the sick hut, [PAWN_pronoun] told stories to the children.

TribeChild40.title: tribe child
TribeChild40.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a tribe, running around the village, moving with the muffalo herds, learning essential skills from [PAWN_possessive] parents.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] never learned to read and never saw a machine that wasn't an ancient ruin.

AbandonedChild23.title: abandoned child
AbandonedChild23.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born sickly. Thinking that [PAWN_pronoun] would only burden the tribe, [PAWN_possessive] parents exposed [PAWN_objective] to the elements. Somehow, [PAWN_pronoun] survived.

ReclusiveChild81.title: reclusive child
ReclusiveChild81.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] didn't learn to speak until [PAWN_pronoun] was nearly five years old. Even then [PAWN_pronoun] preferred to keep to [PAWN_objective]self.\n\nTo the chagrin of [PAWN_possessive] caretakers, [PAWN_pronoun] made a habit of wandering off to live in the wilderness for weeks at a time.

Herder19.title: herder
Herder19.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] tended the muffalo herds, keeping them safe from predators and treating sick animals. It was quiet work, but [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed being away from people.

Scavenger22.title: scavenger
Scavenger22.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood escaping grunt work to go digging through wrecks and ruins for treasures. [PAWN_possessive] natural curiosity got [PAWN_objective] into a lot of trouble, but it also yielded many interesting finds.

CaveChild30.title: cave child
CaveChild30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a large and intricate cave complex that extended deep into a mountainside. [PAWN_pronoun] helped the adults maintain and improve the deep caves.

SoleSurvivor21.title: sole survivor
SoleSurvivor21.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s entire tribe was wiped out in a raid. Though [PAWN_pronoun] was adopted by another group, [PAWN_pronoun] was emotionally scarred, and preferred to stay near home, cooking and tending crops.

VengefulChild43.title: vengeful child
VengefulChild43.desc: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] returned to [PAWN_possessive] village to find that it had been wiped out by bandits. [PAWN_pronoun] swore revenge on the attackers and began a violent rampage across the wilderness.

FireKeeper44.title: fire keeper
FireKeeper44.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was responsible for keeping the tribe's fire going. [PAWN_pronoun] took this responsibility very seriously.

Hideaway9.title: hideaway
Hideaway9.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s overprotective parents encouraged [PAWN_objective] to stay at home nearly every day. Though[PAWN_pronoun] had a lot of time to read and pursue crafting hobbies, [PAWN_pronoun] never developed normal social skills.

CrashBaby32.title: crash baby
CrashBaby32.desc: As a baby, [PAWN_nameDef] was the only survivor of a deadly spacecraft crash. A passing tribe discovered [PAWN_objective] in the wreckage and adopted [PAWN_objective].

BuddingArtist44.title: budding artist
BuddingArtist44.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] had a knack for art. Traders and collectors from many different societies sought to buy [PAWN_possessive] creations.

Bully70.title: bully
Bully70.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] tormented other children for fun. To keep [PAWN_objective] busy, an elder assigned [PAWN_objective] to a hunting party at an early age.

Bookworm19.title: bookworm
Bookworm19.desc: Rather than socialize with the other children, [PAWN_nameDef] preferred to get lost in literature. [PAWN_pronoun] taught [PAWN_objective]self to read at an early age with books bought from passing traders.

FallenProdigy40.title: fallen prodigy
FallenProdigy40.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on a glitterworld falling into chaos. [PAWN_possessive] father was killed in action.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] struggled for a scholarship at Utmaior Academy and had to prove [PAWN_possessive] right to be there. A child genius, [PAWN_pronoun] was bullied as a charity case and couldn't make friends with the other kids.

MadScientist0.title: mad scientist
MadScientist0.desc: Stripped of [PAWN_possessive] life’s work and exiled after [PAWN_possessive] unethical experiments on the survivors of the Callos IX incident were published, [PAWN_nameDef] learned the skills necessary to survive in the outer rim.\n\nContinuing [PAWN_possessive] research with nothing left to lose, [PAWN_pronoun] made minions to carry out the tasks that bored him.

FarmKid60.title: farm kid
FarmKid60.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up on [PAWN_possessive] family's beef farm. [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed working the fields and taking care of the animals.

CivilEngineer2.title: civil engineer
CivilEngineer2.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a well-known civil engineer. [PAWN_possessive] job involved designing and maintaining rock fortification structures. [PAWN_pronoun] did enough statistical analysis to keep [PAWN_possessive] mind sharp.

FarmerBoy88.title: farmer boy
FarmerBoy88.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s parents died in a fire when [PAWN_pronoun] was seven. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up on [PAWN_possessive] uncle's farm, plowing fields and doing manual labor.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] could not bear answering questions about [PAWN_possessive] parents, so [PAWN_pronoun] replaced social contact with hard work.

ArmyCook0.title: army cook
ArmyCook0.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] joined the army as a worker and spent most of [PAWN_possessive] time cooking and repairing. While [PAWN_pronoun] was stationed on a dangerous planet, [PAWN_pronoun] underwent basic shooting and survival training.

UrbworldCriminal80.title: urbworld criminal
UrbworldCriminal80.desc: Born into bad circumstance on an overpopulated urbworld, [PAWN_nameDef] turned to small-time crime as a way to avoid starvation and hypothermia.\n\nRobbery and murder were daily activities for him. [PAWN_nameDef] learned that surviving was winning.

UrbworldPolitican92.title: urbworld politican
UrbworldPolitican92.desc: It's no secret that the Companies own much of the urbworlds, but someone has to take the bribes. [PAWN_nameDef] was one such figurehead.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] learned how to manipulate the hopes and dreams of the people while living comfortably in a penthouse.

OptimisticChild30.title: optimistic child
OptimisticChild30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was blessed with loving parents and a pleasant midworld life. [PAWN_pronoun] was an optimistic and sociable kid who loved making friends and listening to their stories. [PAWN_possessive] imagination would run wild with ideas and questions.

GraphicDesigner33.title: graphic designer
GraphicDesigner33.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]' interest in artistic expression led [PAWN_objective] to become a designer. [PAWN_possessive] eye for detail made [PAWN_objective] a reasonably well-known artist on [PAWN_possessive] planet, though [PAWN_possessive] meticulousness often led [PAWN_objective] to spend too much time perfecting a single project.

UrbworldHooligan12.title: urbworld hooligan
UrbworldHooligan12.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a dangerous urbworld. [PAWN_pronoun] quickly learned how to get [PAWN_possessive] daily meal - by crime. Such means left little to no space for cooking and growing activities.

SpaceTechnician29.title: space technician
SpaceTechnician29.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] finally managed to flee [PAWN_possessive] criminal life by getting a maintenance job on a nearby space station. [PAWN_pronoun] performed multiple repairing and building operations. [PAWN_pronoun] also used to participate in basic research activities and often defused co-workers' arguments. [PAWN_pronoun] never liked doing art.

IndworldUrchin73.title: indworld urchin
IndworldUrchin73.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up on the streets of a world in the early stages of its industrial revolution. [PAWN_pronoun] passed [PAWN_possessive] days stealing, begging and tinkering with discarded machine scraps, always on the lookout for a way to escape poverty.

DoomsdayPariah24.title: doomsday pariah
DoomsdayPariah24.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] managed to open a vault of otherworldly technology while scavenging a dig site. [PAWN_pronoun] unwittingly triggered a doomsday device that cleansed the planet of all life. More interested in the tech than human life, [PAWN_pronoun] boarded the vault’s spacecraft and departed to find more relics to abuse.

ChildScientist30.title: child scientist
ChildScientist30.desc: After graduating college very young, [PAWN_nameDef] devoted [PAWN_possessive] life to becoming immortal. [PAWN_pronoun] was arrested for trying to genetically modify [PAWN_objective]self.\n\nThe authorities released [PAWN_objective] on the condition that [PAWN_pronoun] would work in a government lab on spacecraft technology. [PAWN_pronoun] was permitted to continue [PAWN_possessive] personal research in [PAWN_possessive] free time.

CombatEngineer30.title: combat engineer
CombatEngineer30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was recruited by the military as an engineer and set to work improving the navy's space shuttles. The harsh training taught [PAWN_objective] how to build and repair military vehicles and structures.\n\nOne mission left [PAWN_nameDef] with pyrophobia and a strong desire to avoid plants.

MechanoidNerd10.title: mechanoid nerd
MechanoidNerd10.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in an urbworld as the only child of a pair of mechanoid designers. They encouraged [PAWN_possessive] interest in the machines. Eventually, [PAWN_pronoun] became obsessed with building [PAWN_possessive] own.\n\nUnfortunately this also lead to [PAWN_objective] being a loner as [PAWN_pronoun] prefered technical books to friends.

MilitaryEngineer45.title: military engineer
MilitaryEngineer45.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as an engineer for a colonial military. [PAWN_pronoun] got to play with weapons, murder-drones, and other 'fun' stuff.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] specialized in repairing and modifying mechanoids' tools. Sometimes [PAWN_pronoun] tested them [PAWN_objective]self.

ColiseumCleaner54.title: coliseum cleaner
ColiseumCleaner54.desc: During the 'Inner Destrian War' fallout, [PAWN_possessive] parents were captured and [PAWN_pronoun] was born into a life of slavery. Forced to clean coliseums after bloody battles for money. Watching, waiting, and learning. Coliseums were the only thing [PAWN_pronoun] ever knew. One night while cleaning the coliseum, [PAWN_possessive] family was murdered.

ColiseumFighter22.title: coliseum fighter
ColiseumFighter22.desc: Applying the knowledge that [PAWN_pronoun] gained from years around fighters, [PAWN_pronoun] became a successful gladiator in the coliseum that [PAWN_pronoun] once cleaned.

OfficerCadet25.title: officer cadet
OfficerCadet25.desc: From a young age, [PAWN_nameDef] trained to be a leader of men. [PAWN_pronoun] enrolled in the Vanu Defense College when [PAWN_pronoun] was a boy and became proficient with a range of weapons and survival techniques.

FighterController67.title: fighter controller
FighterController67.desc: During the Zartha crisis, [PAWN_nameDef] fought across many worlds, providing the vital link between the ground and the air as a fighter controller. During the campaign, [PAWN_pronoun] saw friends injured and killed. This mental trauma haunts [PAWN_possessive] dreams to this day, but [PAWN_possessive] aim remains sharp.

ReclusiveProdigy96.title: reclusive prodigy
ReclusiveProdigy96.desc: Growing up on a flourishing glitterworld afforded [PAWN_nameDef] the chance to fully devote [PAWN_objective]self to [PAWN_possessive] studies.\n\nHaving taken a keen interest in genetic modification and neural augmentation from a young age, [PAWN_pronoun] had little time (or desire) for a regular childhood.

FerventResearcher72.title: fervent researcher
FerventResearcher72.desc: As a young adult, [PAWN_nameDef] was sure that [PAWN_possessive] planet and its people were nearing their time of transcendence.\n\nA firm belief that [PAWN_possessive] research would be the catalyst drove [PAWN_objective] to increasingly alarming acts as bureaucrats and bioethics committees worked to stall [PAWN_possessive] progress.

WarRefugee96.title: war refugee
WarRefugee96.desc: A war broke on out [PAWN_nameDef]'s home planet.\n\nGathering what little food and belongings they could, [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] father stole a ship and escaped into space.

VengefulExplorer54.title: vengeful explorer
VengefulExplorer54.desc: A violent drifter without a home, [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] father fought many battles across hundreds of years. [PAWN_pronoun] became a grizzled fighter and crack shot.\n\nAfter [PAWN_possessive] father's death in battle, [PAWN_nameDef] began exploring the stars alone, seeking [PAWN_possessive] father's killer, on the hunt for revenge.

WorkCampSlave37.title: work camp slave
WorkCampSlave37.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up as a slave to a particularly nasty noble family on a medieval world. \n\nWhile [PAWN_pronoun] received no formal education, the harsh labor regimen made [PAWN_possessive] body strong.

BanishedSoldier85.title: banished soldier
BanishedSoldier85.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] became the most physically intimidating of the slaves, spending [PAWN_possessive] little free time obsessively sculpting [PAWN_possessive] body. [PAWN_possessive] efforts eventually paid off when the lord offered [PAWN_objective] a job as a personal bodyguard.\n\nLater, when [PAWN_pronoun] plotted to use [PAWN_possessive] position to kill the lord and free the slaves, [PAWN_pronoun] was discovered and barely escaped with [PAWN_possessive] life.

DisciplinedFarmer28.title: disciplined farmer
DisciplinedFarmer28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the younger of two sons on the family farm, a frontier plot that struggled to turn a profit. [PAWN_nameDef]'s father was a strict disciplinarian, constantly at [PAWN_possessive] sons to work harder and keep quiet. [PAWN_nameDef] burnt [PAWN_possessive] hand making breakfast once and swore to cook only when [PAWN_possessive] life was in danger.

StalwartFarmer21.title: stalwart farmer
StalwartFarmer21.desc: With the farm under constant threat from brigands, [PAWN_nameDef] learned to defend [PAWN_objective]self with [PAWN_possessive] father's hunting rifle. [PAWN_pronoun] also mastered how to construct fences to keep livestock in and the local wildlife out. [PAWN_nameDef] tried to paint a picture of [PAWN_possessive] home and learned [PAWN_pronoun] can only draw scribbles and ducks.

VoyagerChild94.title: voyager child
VoyagerChild94.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was raised on an R&D starship, and spent most of [PAWN_possessive] childhood travelling through the void.\n\nApproaching a mysterious planetoid, the ship was severely damaged. [PAWN_possessive] next memory is of the ship heading out of orbit, fully repaired. [PAWN_pronoun] soon developed an unnatural gift for technological research.

SpaceResearcher25.title: space researcher
SpaceResearcher25.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] inherited [PAWN_possessive] parents' ship and carried on their research.\n\n[PAWN_possessive] childhood experiences with diverse cultures allowed [PAWN_objective] to preserve [PAWN_possessive] caring nature despite spending most of [PAWN_possessive] life isolated in space.

VatgrownMedic53.title: vatgrown medic
VatgrownMedic53.desc: Raised to be a combat medic, [PAWN_nameDef] was trained in firearms as well as medicine. [PAWN_possessive] favorite phrase when coming upon a wounded soldier was, "Life or death?" Most chose life.

GeneticScientist66.title: genetic scientist
GeneticScientist66.desc: After the war [PAWN_pronoun] joined a genetic engineering firm. [PAWN_pronoun] worked on enhancements for humans and livestock. [PAWN_possessive] experience in inflicting and healing wounds was very beneficial to [PAWN_possessive] work, but [PAWN_pronoun] developed a black sense of humor. This made social gatherings awkward.

CoreDilettante33.title: core dilettante
CoreDilettante33.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] formative years on a glitterworld in the core region, where [PAWN_pronoun] and [PAWN_possessive] friends pursued lives of idle pleasure.\n\nAs [PAWN_pronoun] grew up, [PAWN_pronoun] began to find the life of ease unfulfilling. [PAWN_pronoun] decided to look for a more challenging path.

Reporter71.title: reporter
Reporter71.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent many years as an investigative reporter. [PAWN_pronoun] was notorious for making chaotic reports from exotic locations.\n\nAlthough seen as a lightweight by [PAWN_possessive] critics, [PAWN_pronoun] managed to break several high-profile stories after lengthy investigations.

AspiringPopIdol28.title: aspiring pop idol
AspiringPopIdol28.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was being trained in song and dance to become the next big pop idol. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up being taken care of by company handlers.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] never knew manual labor, but learned a lot about music and social etiquette.

PopIdol59.title: pop idol
PopIdol59.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] performed and did interviews constantly. [PAWN_pronoun] refined [PAWN_possessive] skills in dancing and singing, and became a master of social presentation.

FarmBoy64.title: farm boy
FarmBoy64.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] worked on [PAWN_possessive] family's farm, looking after the animals and treating them when they were injured. Preferring hands-on tasks and the outdoors, [PAWN_pronoun] avoided softer jobs that might have kept [PAWN_objective] cooped up inside.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed this lonely work, and tended to stay out of people's way and do [PAWN_possessive] own thing.

UnstableButcher31.title: unstable butcher
UnstableButcher31.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] began hearing voices. The animals were talking to [PAWN_objective], insulting him. [PAWN_pronoun] came to hate them, and eventually killed [PAWN_possessive] furry former friends. [PAWN_pronoun] started selling the meat just to get human interaction.

LogicalChild2.title: logical child
LogicalChild2.desc: [PAWN_pronoun] preferred logical activities like computers and was completely useless at art.\n\nBeing awkward in social situations, [PAWN_possessive] friends were few but close.

Archaeologist85.title: archaeologist
Archaeologist85.desc: [PAWN_pronoun] was trapped in an uninspired life. One day, [PAWN_pronoun] jumped on a ship to learn archaeology and see the universe.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] learned how to survive. [PAWN_pronoun] also learned about people - although [PAWN_pronoun] understood the dead better than the living.

StationWhelp94.title: station whelp
StationWhelp94.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood as a penniless orphan living on a space station. [PAWN_pronoun] managed to scrape by doing filthy jobs and stealing. [PAWN_pronoun] became so violent due to poor treatment by [PAWN_possessive] “betters” that [PAWN_pronoun] was banished from the station, just to be picked up by space pirates.

PirateKing81.title: pirate king
PirateKing81.desc: With no real care for other people, [PAWN_nameDef] fit in perfectly with the pirate crew that had once held [PAWN_objecive] captive. Shortly after joining the crew, [PAWN_nameDef] began to kill anyone or anything that got in [PAWN_possessive] way—including [PAWN_possessive] crewmates.

ConstructionGrunt84.title: construction grunt
ConstructionGrunt84.desc: Growing up in [PAWN_possessive] father's lab, [PAWN_nameDef] was given the life of an intellectual elite. [PAWN_pronoun] got everything [PAWN_pronoun] desired, and price was never an object.\n\nHowever [PAWN_nameDef] did not partake in the luxury given to him. Instead, [PAWN_pronoun] pursued more physical, and - in [PAWN_possessive] father's eyes - lower-class jobs.

MilitaryInventor35.title: military inventor
MilitaryInventor35.desc: Jackson, in a final act of rebellion, left [PAWN_possessive] father's lab and joined the local Imperial military.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] used [PAWN_possessive] laboratory skills to design machines of war. At this [PAWN_pronoun] was one of the best on [PAWN_possessive] planet.

StudentEngineer34.title: student engineer
StudentEngineer34.desc:
A genius child, [PAWN_nameDef] was put in a special training program covering aerospace warfare and engineering.

One day, [PAWN_pronoun] tried to befriend a squirrel by giving it a bracelet. The squirrel bit [PAWN_objective], earning [PAWN_objective] the nickname “Squirrel {PAWN_gender ? Boy : Girl}”.

[PAWN_nameDef] came to believe that work involving manual labor is beneath [PAWN_objective].

EngineeredPilot75.title: engineered pilot
EngineeredPilot75.desc: After [PAWN_possessive] province was besieged by one of its neighbors, [PAWN_nameDef] volunteered for a generic modification program that created pilots for the very fighter craft that [PAWN_pronoun] had helped develop. The modifications allowed [PAWN_objective] to pilot the ship, but also made [PAWN_objective] less able to focus on the people around him.\n\nBy this time, people were calling [PAWN_objective] "Squirrel."

StreetKid19.title: street kid
StreetKid19.desc: Growing up on the streets and fields of a rimworld, [PAWN_nameDef]'s [PAWN_possessive] only friend was a dog named Rest. The pair scraped by, finding just enough food to survive.\n\nWhen [PAWN_pronoun] was 13 years old, a criminal group took [PAWN_objective] under their wing.

BanditLeader74.title: bandit leader
BanditLeader74.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] rose up the ranks of the crime organization, eventually becoming the leader of one of their most remote cells of bandits. [PAWN_possessive] dog Rest never left [PAWN_possessive] side.

PizzaLover94.title: pizza lover
PizzaLover94.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] loved boomrat pizza intensely. Rarely eating anything else, [PAWN_pronoun] was prone to bad health and low oxygen uptake.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] loved bashing in the skulls of random creatures to see what was inside.

Gigolo68.title: gigolo
Gigolo68.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] sold [PAWN_objective]self into slavery for money to purchase boomrat pizza. [PAWN_pronoun] was then traded to the Zeglar colonies, where [PAWN_pronoun] worked as a male prostitute.\n\nIn a fluke event, [PAWN_pronoun] managed to join other escaping slaves as they hijacked a ship. After fighting with the captain of the slave crew over the last piece of boomrat pizza, [PAWN_nameDef] was sent off the ship in an escape pod.

FrontierMarshal54.title: frontier marshal
FrontierMarshal54.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] inherited a sense of duty from [PAWN_possessive] father, and began a law enforcement career on [PAWN_possessive] frontier homeworld.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] tried to uphold the law with honor, but the corruption and greed of local government officials often discouraged him.

ColonialGovernor78.title: colonial governor
ColonialGovernor78.desc: Disillusioned by rampant government corruption, [PAWN_nameDef] ran for governor and won. However, the local gangs and their pet officials soon forced [PAWN_objective] out of power.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] left the community to return to [PAWN_possessive] life as a marshal.

MercenaryRecruit64.title: mercenary recruit
MercenaryRecruit64.desc: Descended from a long line of mercenaries, [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a busy trading hub.\n\n[PAWN_possessive]'s interest in the foreign goods at the market often distracted [PAWN_objective] from [PAWN_possessive] chores and training.

MercenaryChef44.title: mercenary chef
MercenaryChef44.desc: Following in [PAWN_possessive] family's footsteps, [PAWN_nameDef] was a soldier for hire.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] was a naturally gifted sharpshooter. However, [PAWN_possessive] real passion is in perfecting a new recipe or dissecting a new gadget.

AbandonedChild30.title: abandoned child
AbandonedChild30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a quick witted, funny child. One day, [PAWN_pronoun] wandered off on [PAWN_possessive] wealthy parents, and was ultimately lost in a supposedly unused ore warehouse. Due to cloning technology, [PAWN_possessive] parents decided that the time looking for [PAWN_objective] was better spent on just cloning a better son.

CargoPilot58.title: cargo pilot
CargoPilot58.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was brought up by cargo hands on a long-haul ore transport ship. [PAWN_pronoun] perfected [PAWN_possessive] skills at trading and manipulation of people while running weapons between systems.

TradersChild62.title: traders' child
TradersChild62.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a family of nomadic traders, making a living from selling and buying goods on many worlds.\n\n[PAWN_nameDef] learned the customs and methods of trade of many cultures by participating in [PAWN_possessive] parents' business.

SpaceHumanitarian9.title: space humanitarian
